remarks: The domain of definition of the internal direct product, which states that ` S ` is a family of subgroups that mutually commute and have trivial intersections.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Apr-2016.) (Revised by AV, 14-Jul-2019.)
statement:
eldprdi.0 $e |- .0. = ( 0g ` G ) $.
eldprdi.w $e |- W = { h e. X_ i e. I ( S ` i ) | h finSupp .0. } $.
eldprdi.1 $e |- ( ph -> G dom DProd S ) $.
eldprdi.2 $e |- ( ph -> dom S = I ) $.
eldprdi.3 $e |- ( ph -> F e. W ) $.
eldprdi $p |- ( ph -> ( G gsum F ) e. ( G DProd S ) ) $.
$d .0. h $.
$d F h $.
$d G h i $.
$d I h i $.
$d S h i $.
